entries.femaleVariant: Welcome to "Safe and Sound." My name is Sergeant Dobs, and today I'll tell you how to live in harmony alongside the Night City Police Department.
Our buddy, Mr. Puggins, is on his way to work when he notices a police cruiser flash its lights behind him.
But because he's in a rush to an important meeting, Mr. Puggins decides to ignore the police.
Better think twice, Mr. Puggins. Under the Safe Streets Act, the NCPD has the right to open fire on any vehicle that refuses to pull over. Let's give him another chance.
This time he promptly pulls to the side of the road, and knows to turn off his engine, rest his head against the steering wheel, and place his paws behind his head.
As the police officer approaches the vehicle, Mr. Puggins decides he'd like to ask why he's been stopped.
Wrong again, Mr. Puggins! It's the police who ask the questions – not you. Remember – never speak or make eye contact with an NCPD officer unless told to do so.
The officer tells Mr. Puggins to step out of the vehicle, but he only moves to stand next to the car. That's not gonna cut it!
In this situation, you must lie down with your face to the ground and paws behind your head. If you don't do this on your own, the officer will be forced to assist you.
Excellent! The officer has finished his search, and everything appears to be in order. Mr. Puggins is free to carry on.
But before hitting the road, don't forget to extend a small token of your appreciation for the police officer's service.
Always follow this advice to enjoy a safe and problem-free relationship with your local law enforcement.
That's all for this episode of "Safe and Sound." Stay alive out there!
